metadata.title: Q-Solutions | Indoor Air Quality Management
metadata.description: Real-time air quality monitoring with AIoT sensors and scientific infection risk analysis for safer indoor environments.

hero.title: Is Your Space
hero.description: We analyze invisible airborne risks in real-time and create safe indoor environments with scientific data.

problem.title: We spend 90% of our day indoors.
problem.description: Fine dust, CO2, airborne bacteria... invisible threats are affecting your health.

infection.title: Airborne Infection Risk
infection.description: Respiratory diseases spread rapidly in enclosed spaces. Infection risk increases up to 10 times with poor ventilation.

productivity.title: Reduced Focus & Productivity
productivity.description: When CO2 levels exceed 1,000ppm, drowsiness and headaches occur, and cognitive ability can drop by up to 50%.

health.title: Chronic Health Issues
health.description: Long-term exposure to polluted air increases the risk of respiratory diseases, allergies, and cardiovascular conditions.

page.heroDescription: Discover real results and experiences from organizations that have implemented Q-Solutions.

hospital.title: Changwon Hanmaeum Hospital Pediatrics
hospital.subtitle: Building a Safe Infection-Free Environment for Pediatric Patients
hospital.challenge: Due to the nature of pediatrics, many patients had weak immune systems, making hospital-acquired infections a high risk. Secondary infections within the ward repeatedly occurred during seasonal outbreaks, and the existing ventilation system had limitations in air quality management.
hospital.solution: Q-Solutions infection control system was deployed to monitor air quality in each room in real-time and calculate infection probability based on the Wells-Riley model. Automatic alerts and air purifier integration maintain optimal conditions when ventilation is insufficient.
hospital.testimonial: Hospital-acquired infections have noticeably decreased in the 6 months since installation. Parents especially appreciate being able to check air quality on monitors outside the rooms.

university.title: KAIST Chemical Engineering Labs
university.subtitle: Real-time Monitoring System for Hazardous Chemicals
university.challenge: Managing researcher exposure to hazardous materials was difficult in an environment using various organic solvents and chemicals. Health concerns were continuously raised due to inadequate ventilation during long experiments.
university.solution: Dedicated sensors for VOCs, formaldehyde, and other hazardous materials were installed, with cumulative exposure tracking for each researcher. Immediate warnings are triggered at dangerous concentrations, with monitoring until ventilation is complete after experiments.
results: 60% reduction in abnormal health checkup findings
university.testimonial: We can focus on research while still being aware of safety. The personal exposure reports are particularly helpful for health management.

school.title: Seoul Gangnam Elementary School
school.subtitle: Student Health and Learning Focus Enhancement Project
school.challenge: Colds and flu spread every winter, causing frequent class-wide absences. Students also experienced drowsiness and reduced focus during afternoon classes, with ventilation timing often being missed.
school.solution: Air quality sensors were installed in each classroom to measure CO2 levels and humidity in real-time. Automatic ventilation alerts are sent to teachers, and weekly classroom environment reports are provided to parents.
results: Selected as Education Board best practice
school.testimonial: Thanks to ventilation alerts, children stay alert and focused during class. Parents also feel reassured when they see the reports.

government.title: Gyeongnam Provincial Office Service Center
government.subtitle: Creating a Pleasant Space for Citizens and Staff
government.challenge: Air quality management was difficult in a service center used by over 300 people daily. CO2 levels spiked during peak hours, and frequent fine dust infiltration caused discomfort for both visitors and staff.
government.solution: Real-time air quality monitoring was installed with large public displays showing current status. Automatic integration with ventilation systems and air purifiers maintains optimal conditions.
government.testimonial: With air quality visible at a glance, visitor complaints have greatly decreased. Staff also report feeling less tired in the afternoon.

fitness.title: Gimhae National Sports Center
fitness.subtitle: Sports Facility Air Quality Optimization Project
fitness.challenge: Due to high breathing rates and perspiration in exercise facilities, air quality deteriorated quickly. Managing CO2 levels and humidity in the enclosed gym was a major challenge.
fitness.solution: Custom sensors were deployed in each exercise area with automatic ventilation based on occupancy and exercise intensity. Real-time air quality displays at entrances increase user confidence.
fitness.testimonial: Many users say they no longer feel suffocated while exercising. Our renewal rate has also increased.

nursing.title: Busan Haeundae Nursing Hospital
nursing.subtitle: Infection Prevention System for Elderly Patients
nursing.challenge: Many elderly patients with underlying conditions were highly vulnerable to infections. After COVID-19, visitor restrictions and hospital infection management became even more important.
nursing.solution: Real-time infection risk analysis by ward with automatic ventilation and air purification adjustment based on risk levels. Air quality is automatically optimized before and after visiting hours.
nursing.testimonial: We can protect our elderly patients' health while safely allowing family visits. It's a great relief.
